contextId.information: The word "advocate" here refers to Jesus. AT: "someone who speaks to God the Father and asks him to forgive us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here, "beginning" refers to when they decided to follow Christ. AT: "from when you first believed in Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

"remember and believe what you have heard from the beginning." How they heard it, what they heard, and what "the beginning" means can be made explicit: AT: "continue to trust what we have taught you about Jesus just as you have trusted since you first became believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: let what you have heard from the beginning remain in you

contextId.information: "live for him." See how this phrase was translated in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:02:04|2:5-6]]. How a person remains refers to his fellowship or relationship. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The translator can state more clearly the implied reason about why we should believe what God says: AT: "If we believe what people say, then we should believe what God says because he always tells the truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater
